Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef Sync="TRUE">Internal feature number.</attrdef><attrdefs Sync="TRUE">ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom Sync="TRUE">Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ACEC_ID</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ACEC_ID</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">10</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The designed primary key that will uniquely identify a single occurrence of the entity.  The primary key for ACEC will be 10 digits. The first four will be "ACEC" and the last six digits will be a sequential number.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ACEC_NAME</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ACEC_NAME</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">60</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The name of the ACEC taken from the Record of Decision and Land Use Plan which officially designated the ACEC.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">LOC_ACEC_I</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">LOC_ACEC_I</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">20</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">LUP_NAME</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">LUP_NAME</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">50</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The name given to a project that represents the full, official name associated with the project</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">CASEFILE_N</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">CASEFILE_N</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">17</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ROD_DATE</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ROD_DATE</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Date</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">8</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The date on which the decision is signed by the person who has approval authority for the decisions.    The Record of Decision (ROD) signing date of the monitoring or activity plan, if any, for the particular ACEC.  The date will be in the format of MM/DD/YYYY.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ACEC_EST_A</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ACEC_EST_A</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">18</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">8</attscale></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">GIS_ACRES</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">GIS_ACRES</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">18</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">8</attscale><attrdef>This is a calculated value of area in units of acres based on the area field created by default within the ESRI Polygon data structure.  For the purposes of a 'national data layer', the data are to be stored in geographic coordinates which do not correspond to ground values.  This requires that there be a standard method for calculating this attribute.   The method used for these data are as follows:  The data are projected into a standard projection such as the ESRI default Albers projection for the continental United States, "US Albers NAD 1983."  Once the data are projected, then a calculation of "SHAPE_Area (square meters) * 0.0002471044  = acres" is applied to the existing 'area' field that is default area created by the ESRI software resulting in the field (Attribute) 'SHAPE_Area'.  Please note that the figure used in this calculation is the factor for converting the US Survey Foot value of for the length of a meter as opposed to the International Standard for converting meters and feet.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ADMIN_ST</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ADMIN_ST</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">2</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>An administrative unit that identifies the state or geographic area which has administrative jurisdiction over lands, and cases, although the land for a case may not be physically located in a state. Only those states that are BLM administrative states are in the domain for this entity. Example: Montana is the Administrative State for public lands in the geographic States of Montana, South and North Dakota.  A two letter, upper case abbreviation for the administrative state office.  Attribute Domain Assignment:  DOM_ADMIN_ST  Default:  XX</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ADM_OFC_CD</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">ADM_OFC_CD</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">6</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>BLM administrative office (which is subordinate to the state office) that has jurisdiction and/or management authority over lands within a geographic area.  This is a six-digit code.  In the FBMS Organization Codes, use the six characters after the State designators.  e.g. LLAK030900)</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">COMMENTS</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">COMMENTS</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">String</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">250</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef>The text that provides additional information about the Area of Critical Environmental Concern.</attrdef><attrdefs>BLM</attrdefs></attr><attr><attrlabl Sync="TRUE">ADM_UNIT_C</attrlabl><attalias Sync="TRUE">Shape_area</attalias><attrtype Sync="TRUE">Double</attrtype><attwidth Sync="TRUE">19</attwidth><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale><attrdef Sync="TRUE">Area of feature in internal units squared.</attrdef><attrdefs Sync="TRUE">ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom Sync="TRUE">Positive real numbers that are automatically Sciences</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-373-3950</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntAddress addressType="both" /></rpCntInfo><role><RoleCd value="007" /></role></mdContact><mdStanName>ArcGIS Metadata</mdStanName><mdStanVer>1.0</mdStanVer><dataIdInfo><idCitation><resTitle Sync="FALSE">ACEC Historic (POLYGONS)</resTitle><date><pubDate date="inapplicable" /></date><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Bureau of Land Management, Idaho State Offices, Engineering and Geographic Sciences</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="006" /></role></citRespParty><presForm><PresFormCd value="005" Sync="TRUE" /></presForm><citRespParty><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="010" /></role></citRespParty></idCitation><idAbs><DIV STYLE="text-align:Left;"><DIV><DIV><P><SPAN>BLM Manual 1613, dated 9/29/1988, describes Areas of Critical Environmental Concern (ACEC) as: "ACEC designations highlight areas where special management attention is needed to protect, and prevent irreparable damage to, important historic, cultural, and scenic values, fish, or wildlife resources or other natural systems or processes; or to protect human life and safety from natural hazards. The ACEC designation indicates to the public that the BLM recognizes that an area has significant values and has established special management measures to protect those values. In addition designation also serves as a reminder that significant value(s) or resource(s) exist which must be accommodated when future management actions and land use proposals are considered near or within an ACEC." This dataset contains all of the current Idaho ACECs that were created through the Resource Management Plan (RMP) or Management Framework Plan (MFP) process. The ACECs include ACEC's, Research Natural Areas (RNAs) and Outstanding Natural Areas (ONAs). RNAs are areas where natural processes are allowed to predominate and which is preserved for the primary purposes of research and education. Under current BLM policy, RNAs must meet the relevance and importance criteria of ACECs and are designated as ACECs. Criteria for RNAs can be found at: BLM Manual 1613 and 43 CFR 1610.7-2(b). ONAs are areas with high scenic values that have been little altered by human impact. Under current BLM policy, ONAs must meet the relevance and importance criteria of ACECs and are designated as ACECs. Criteria for ONAs can be found at: BLM Manual 1613 and 43 CFR 1610.7-2(b).</SPAN></P></DIV></DIV></DIV></idAbs><idPurp>The intent of the historical feature class is to store changes to Designated ACEC polygons only. The historical feature class should remain empty until something has changed in a feature.</idPurp><idCredit>Geographic Sciences. Idaho State Office, Bureau of Land Management</idCredit><idStatus><ProgCd value="007" /></idStatus><idPoC><rpOrgName>Idaho State Office, Bureau of Land Management</rpOrgName><rpPosName>Supervisor Geographic Sciences</rpPosName><rpCntInfo><cntPhone><voiceNum>208-373-3950</voiceNum></cntPhone><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>Bureau of Land Management</delPoint><delPoint>Idaho State Office</delPoint><delPoint>1387 S. This linework incorporates various techniques including digitizing from paper maps and on screen digitizing. At a later date, the ACEC goes through a BLM serialization process to legally define the boundary. Every effort was made to identify and use appropriate sources to accurately depict the boundary.</measDesc></report><dataLineage><prcStep><stepDesc>This is a National Operations Center (NOC) national dataset. This dataset is designed to be spatially and schematically consistent with surrounding state's data to permit the aggregation into a single seamless dataset. This dataset is being compared with the surrounding states to identify border inconsistencies. There is a continuous ongoing effort to identify and resolve these issues. They will be resolved as soon as they are identified and adjoining state's Data Stewards can meet to discuss and agree on a mutual resolution. It should be noted that these are state maintained datasets and may upon aggregation exhibit slightly differing spatial characteristics depending on the originating state's GIS techniques and the techniques used in the NOC aggregation process.</stepDesc></prcStep><prcStep><stepDesc>This dataset was created to meet the requirements of the NOC ACEC data call and had not existed prior to this data call. Supplementary notes include; Lucile Caves was modified in the RMP. So in the historic , you have the piece that was removed from the original.</stepDesc></prcStep><dataSource type=""><srcMedName><MedNameCd value="027" /></srcMedName><srcScale><rfDenom>24</rfDenom></srcScale></dataSource><statement>This original FGDC metadata document was upgraded from ESRI Version 9 to Version 10 using the ArcCatalog Description Upgrade tool.  The FGDC component of the metadata was then removed from the ArcGIS metadata.  These programmatic processes may fail or inconsistently migrate the metadata or fail to maintain the chronological order of the original FGDC metadata entries.  Efforts were made to review the upgraded ArcGIS metadata; however the metadata user needs to carefully and completely read the entire metadata document and when appropriate notify the BLM distributor of any metadata inconsistencies.  BLM strives to update the metadata as funding and priorities permit.  This process was completed in September 2012.</statement><prcStep><stepDesc>IDAHO BUREAU OF LAND MANAGEMENT FORM ID-9167 GEOSPATIAL DATA QUALITY ASSURANCE /QUALITY CONTROL AUTHORIZATION PAGE.</stepDesc><stepRat>Entry removed September 2012 to simplify metadata entries.</stepRat><stepDateTm>2010-06-01T00:00:00</stepDateTm></prcStep></dataLineage></dqInfo><mdHrLvName Sync="TRUE">dataset</mdHrLvName><refSysInfo><RefSystem><refSysID><identCode code="102605" Sync="TRUE" value="102605" /><idCodeSpace Sync="TRUE">ESRI</idCodeSpace><idVersion Sync="TRUE">10.1.1</idVersion></refSysID></RefSystem></refSysInfo><spatRepInfo><VectSpatRep><geometObjs Name="BDY_NOC_ACECHist_PUB_24K_POLY"><geoObjTyp><GeoObjTypCd value="002" Sync="TRUE" /></geoObjTyp><geoObjCnt Sync="TRUE">12</geoObjCnt></geometObjs><topLvl><TopoLevCd value="001" Sync="TRUE" /></topLvl></VectSpatRep></spatRepInfo><mdDateSt Sync="TRUE">20130509</mdDateSt><distInfo><distFormat><formatName Sync="TRUE">Shapefile</formatName></distFormat><distTranOps><transSize Sync="TRUE">0.013</transSize></distTranOps><distributor xmlns=""><distorCont xmlns=""><rpOrgName>U.S. Department of the Interior (DOI), Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Idaho State Office</rpOrgName><role><RoleCd value="005" /></role><rpCntInfo xmlns=""><cntAddress addressType="both"><delPoint>1387 S.
